trans-unit.source: If a resource directory is specified using

If given Zope’s default temporary storage definition will be replaced by the lines of this parameter. If set to “off” or “false”, no temporary storage definition will be created. This prevents startup issues for basic Zope 4 sites as it does not ship with the required packages by default anymore.
trans-unit.target: If given Zope’s default temporary storage definition will be replaced by the lines of this parameter. If set to “off” or “false”, no temporary storage definition will be created. This prevents startup issues for basic Zope 4 sites as it does not ship with the required packages by default anymore.

trans-unit.source: Offset applied to the port numbers used for ZServer configurations. For example, if the http-server port is 8080 and the port-base is 1000, the HTTP server will listen on port 9080. This makes it easy to change the complete set of ports used by a Zope server process. Zope defaults to 0.

trans-unit.source: command is similar to the fg command, but it does not create a subprocess to start up Zope. This is useful for two use cases. First, the supervisor program, to supervise long running processes like a Zope, require the process not to fork away, so that supervisor can control it. Second, IDEs like WingIDE and PyCharm support debugging running processes from within. For this to work, the process should also not fork away.
trans-unit.target: 命令类似于fg命令,但是它没有创建一个子进程来启动Zope。这对两个用例很有用。第一,监理程序,要监理像Zope这样长期运行的进程,要求进程不分叉,这样监理就可以控制它。第二,像WingIDE和PyCharm这样的IDE支持从内部调试正在运行的进程。要做到这一点,进程也应该不fork掉。
